titles.title: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017

descriptions.description: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2017 is a computer-assisted telephone survey of 1200 Albertan adults. It is a portion of the 2017 Alberta Survey conducted by the Population Research Lab (PRL), and commissioned by PolicyWise for Children & Families (formerly the Alberta Centre for Child, Family and Community Research) and funded by Alberta Health. 16 questions were asked relating to general knowledge about Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder; personal experience relating to FASD; and attitudes concerning prevention. These metadata can also be found on the SAGE metadata website: http://sagemetadata.policywise.com/nada/index.php/catalog/15
